definition: advantageous/favorable/to benefit at others' expense/to take unfair advantage
variant of 占[zhan4]
to observe/to divine
to take possession of/to occupy/to take up
plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards
see 便宜|便宜[pian2 yi5]
surname Yi
proper/should/suitable/appropriate

sentences.english: It would be an imposition on his good nature.
sentences.chinese: 这在他的善良本性上是一次占便宜。

sentences.english: The nun wished to burn incense before her golden Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 尼姑想给她的金佛烧香，又不愿意让别的佛像占便宜。

sentences.english: If you break faith and try to take advantage, I'll find someone else to work with.
sentences.chinese: 若你背信或相占便宜，我就会找别人。

sentences.english: You won't be hornswoggled if you don't want to gain extra advantage.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不想占便宜，你就受不了骗。

sentences.english: Is China Freeloading Off The U. S. Military's Work In Afghanistan And Iraq?
sentences.chinese: 美国军队在阿富汗和伊拉克工作，中国却只占便宜吗？

sentences.english: and if they want to sort of free ride on my work, that's their business
sentences.chinese: 如果他们想从我的工作中占便宜，那是他们的事。

sentences.english: Please trust a man who looked at choosing the perfect bridal gown before hand.
sentences.chinese: 请相信一个人看着选择合适的婚纱礼服占便宜。

sentences.english: Do the wealthy have a head start?

definition: to look for a bargain/to seek advantage/to try to gain at expense of others
to suffer losses/to come to grief/to lose out/to get the worst of it/to be at a disadvantage/unfortunately
to loot a burning house/to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
to take advantage of sb's difficulties (idiom)
to reckon/to calculate/to plan/to expect/to scheme
extortion by taking advantage of sb's weakness
to cost one dearly/to end disastrously/to pay bitterly
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
to play dirty tricks/to be up to mischief
convenient
cheap/inexpensive/small advantages/to let sb off lightly
to harbor evil intentions (idiom)
to prevail/to have one's way/to get away with it
without any sense of shame/unembarrassed/shameless
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
greedy
